text:
I friggin' love this place.  My husband and I come here every few weeks or so with our two kids.  The kids love the breakfast pancakes and I love the breakfast sandwich.  My husband gets the steak and eggs for something like $5.  For dinner we usually get the burgers on the buy-one-get-one-free special.  Yes, this place has great specials.  It's a wonderful restaurant for a family on a budget.  

The service tends to be slow.  That's my only real complaint.

We were in the area shopping and decided to look for someplace to eat. We really weren't in the mood for burgers, so Red Robin was out. There were lots of places to choose from, but in the end we decided to try someplace new and since it was close to a Starbucks, Montana Meat Company made the list.

It was early in the afternoon so the place was empty. Some people have complained about the smoke smell, but the restaurant seating is in the back of the place totally separated from the bar. We never noticed any smoke where we were sitting. There was only one other booth occupied when we arrived so we were quickly greeted and seated. Our host was friendly and courteous and appeared glad to see us. We think he also doubles as the bartender since that's where he was when we arrived. He took our drink order while we looked over the menu. While we were waiting for the drinks, the waitress showed up and asked what we wanted to drink. Apparently a communications break between the bar staff and the restaurant staff.

Brenda ordered the flat iron steak with steak fries and I had the Montana Rib Eye with a baked potato. While we waited for the food we did our usual check of the establishment. Overall, it is a nice place with a definite cowboy feel to it. The only negative would be that no one dusts the lamp shades. A tap of the finger on them sent dust cascading down. As we waited, more people began to arrive and the wait staff increased as well. It never seemed as though anyone was waiting to be served or checked on, so overall, we'd rate this as better than average service.

The food arrived and it was cooked as ordered, medium for Brenda and medium rare for me. I'm not really sure what's in the "signature pepper marinade" that they claim the rib eye is aged in. Although the steak was very tender and tasty, I really didn't notice anything special that the marinade would have imparted. The baked potato was slightly undercooked and a bit firm in the center. However, with all the butter, sour cream, and chives that they supply, it tasted fine. You really can't do much to screw up a baked potato. Brenda's flat iron was also good considering it's a cheaper cut of meat from the shoulder. The steak fries were nothing spectacular but there were enough that neither of us could finish all of them. The food that we got was worth the price considering many restaurants in town would be charging an additional $10 per plate for what we got.

Definitely would return to try some of their burgers or even their breakfast menu.
Always great service and food. i love the bacon wrap scallops

It was very good !! And I love this bar!!! Its my favorite place for breakfast. But this morning I got French toast and everything was good but the bacon !! It was cooked for so long I would never eat it!! It would be something the dog would eat ! But I love this place other than that and I'll come again but they should check the cook!! :) :) I love Montana meet co 



Today rating 8-23-14  10:30am 4 stars !!!!!
Had Breakfast with my wife there on Saturday. From the good looking, polite host to the paying the server, great experience. Food was above average, the price was very fair. Staff was awesome!

If you have ever had Montana Meat's American Kobe Burger you will understand how great the 2 for 1 Burger deal is!!! As of right now they have the deal going and it changes usually after a couple of months or so, so don't miss out!  They also have unlimited fries for the burgers which makes it even that much better (I usually get the fries well done, yum).  They also have a great menu ranging from great steaks to nacho appetizers.  So if your lucky enough to have one close by or see one in your travels, stop by and have a great meal.

Favorite place for "neighborhood" restaurant & bar. Food always great & the people even better! Been coming here for years & will continue. Wife had the Beef Medallions & I had the French Dip. Excellent! Wine choices bit limited but pretty good for a neighborhood eatery.
Good food.  Good service.  Not the best ambiance but for the prices and quality that's okay. Will definitely go back!!

Came here with my bf on a weekday afternoon. The place was pretty dead but surprisingly nice and clean. Anyway, we were seated by a nice host who also happened to be our server. The guy took our orders and drinks and was given nice, hot sour dough bread with butter on the side while we waited. My bf ordered a kobe burger and I got grilled salmon...yes I got salmon knowing this place is known for their good burgers and steak. (I recently became pescetarian).  We also got the bacon wrapped scallops everyone was raving about. It didn't take long til we got our food, which was awesome. My bf said his burger was "amazing" and had nothing bad to say about it. My salmon, on the other hand, was dry and bland...I removed the bacon on the scallops and it actually wasn't bad. The scallops were big and juicy and we both enjoyed it. They made some kind of sauce for the scallops which I was not a big fan of, but my bf loved it. 
Overall good place to go, don't get the salmon, I guess get the Kobe because its supposedly "awesome". And yes do try the scallops.

Horrible service, horrible food. Waiter was very unprofessional and 'ghetto'. Steaks were very under cooked and due to the shady staff I was worried to send it back. Expressed my concern with my steak and he didn't rectify the situation in any way. Over paid for shitty good and shitty service.

Breakfast today was fast and there is one server that goes out of her way to ensure you are enjoying your meal. Kudos to her....didn't catch her name but she's been there a while I think. The receptionist today, Sunday 10/9/16 couldn't smile, has an attitude and cannot even say have a nice day to customers leaving. She needs an attitude tune up and put a smile on that pretty face
Great environment, I have been here several times and one of the owners is super cool. Their bacon wrapped shrimp and scallops are a must.

We've been going to Montana for over five years now and absolutely love it. We always sit in the bar and gamble a little bit and eat.

Their food is delicious! The nachos are the best I've ever had. We order them half chicken and half steak. You can even get the steak cooked however you like. The scallops are to die for and their hamburgers are great.

We love the bartenders and always have a fun time.

Ordered the steak it was very dry the baked potato must  have been warmed up  twice the vegetables were hard not edible!  The bacon wrapped shrimp was okay the cocktails were good should have just ordered appetizers no dinner!!

The service was poor it took a good 6min to get a waiter and for a soup that I order it took about 25 minutes and the salad about 40 min, so you will be waiting long for your dinner. The waiter was great to bad the other part of the service was poor. The food was ok not to brag or come back.

I've lived in the NW area for 4 years and kept saying I would try this place. I finally did and can't believe I waited so long. I've only had the rib eye and the medallions so I can only speak of that. The steak was very tender and cooked perfectly. Top your steak with the Cabernet mushrooms and its even more amazing. The service has been wonderful both times that I have eaten there. The prices are good too. Next time, I'm going to try the breakfast that the regulars were raving about.

Took my Dad and BF here last night for a belated Fathers Day dinner.  We were seated right away.  Not too many tables occupied.  The bar area looked pretty busy-maybe for happy hour.  As we were seated the server brought us 2 warm flaky melt-in-your mouth loaves of white Italian bread with butter.  OMG in my mouth!  I am always a big fan of fresh warm bread so that was a good way to start.

The server was nice, not overly friendly but there to do his job. He did check back occasionally to make sure we didn't need anything.  He took our order for dinner and here was our rundown:

*Dad - Blackened salmon with mashed potatoes with a side Caesar salad.  He ate the whole thing and he was stuffed. He said the salmon was so good he couldn't stop eating. LOL

*Mom - Ordered the steak with mashed potatoes.  No complaints from her.

*BF/Me - shared the Caesars Salad and it was really good.

*BF - Cajon pasta with medallion steak.  This is always his favorite only its always very rich.  This time there was way too much sauce.  It was still good but it was just swimming in sauce.  I grabbed a piece of the cheesy toast that it came with (as if I needed any more bread) and it was absolutely horrible!  Not even edible.  It was so salty and I do love my salt but yuck!  He didn't eat any of the bread and rarely does. He says it never looks good.

*Me - Blackened salmon with mashed potatoes.  First off S A L T Y was the theme of the night I guess.  The mashed potatoes were covered with tons of brown gravy-you couldn't even see the potatoes.  The gravy was so salty....maybe if there was a small dallup of gravy it wouldn't seem so overpowering but gollllly.  The salmon was a little dry so I asked for this lemon butter sauce that you have to ask for and it made it a little better.  The whole dish was really salty.  I left about less than half my dinner there.  The salt was just too much.  Oh yeah there were green beans too on there that I didn't eat. 

The bill was about $90 with tip.  As we were walking out BF got suddenly got sick and ran to the bathroom.  Not a good sign if you cant make it out the door right?   Yeah we got our Montana Meats fix for now.  We will be back when we forget this dining experience.  It has been pretty good in the past...
Wait for food too long. Don't bother ordering French dip no flavor. Ranch dressing runny like milk. Very noisy. Crew seemed out of step. Not enough help on floor and in kitchen.

Food was good, had their Blue Flatiron Steak basically a Flatiron steak topped with blue cheese. My only complaint was that the wait for service took a while, and waiting for meal to arrive also took a while. So keep in mind if you are in a hurry this may not be the place to go.
We had the special ribeye steak for two and it was very good I would recommend this place.

The service was very good so I have no complaints there, the server was very attentive. The food came very fast  it wasn't busy for being a Sunday morning. However my only complaint that has me leaving the three stars comes from my pancakes tasting like onions. My sons omelette order did have onions in it and we both always order the exact same thing when we go there for breakfast but this is the first time I've ever tasted onions on my pancakes. The server did offer to bring me something else but once you've tasted onion pancakes your taste buds have no desire for anything else at that moment. I personally like onions but not on my pancakes. The server did take the 3.00 for the short stack off of my bill, I hadn't asked her to so that was nice of her.  The problem came from the kitchen and a manager never came over to the table. I guess it's not a big deal if you're served onion pancakes.  Eek!!!
Good food, well priced, good service, great bartender.  Thanks for a nice evening.
Used to just work down the street from here and constantly ordered their breakfast! Crazy cheap and super good! Best chicken fried steak ever! Customer service is awesome selection is great!

My filet was overcooked and dry, I'd asked for medium and received almost well done. The side of mushrooms were not fully cooked down, as though they had just heated some mushrooms and splashed wine over them. Not worth the cost, will not be going back.

This review is strictly on the dining and nothing regarding the bar. First off, the place isn't popular, so going there, you won't have to worry about parking unless it's a church day as you'll find most places to be full on a church day. The waiter is nowhere to be found, so we had to wait. The wait consisted of 10 minutes and being able to see 10 open tables. We sat down, ordered. One thing I noticed right off the bat was the price. Absolutely affordable. A good meal would consist of about $7 and you will certainly get a wealthy amount of food. Great for breakfast.

My wife and I used to frequent this restaurant, after last night we will never go back! Ordered the chicken parmigiana, looked and tasted like came out of a can! Was horrible, I asked for something else, no manager came by the table to ask what was wrong, I remember the place used to have great food. We will never go back.

Love coming here with the family. Great American comfort food with hearty portions. This place is not fancy at all but I find the ambience casual and welcoming. Servers are very helpful and attentive. This place has a nice selection of meat dishes, fish, and steaks. 

Our family seems to love this place for those nights when you don't feel like cooking but you don't want to break the bank eating out. A great little find in the Centennial Hills area without the boring franchise feel.

They advertise on the internet for breakfast at $5.95, well they don't have that, not a big deal, they do have breakfast for $ 6.95, I had a western omelette, breakfast potatoes and sourdough toast, The Omelette at best was Bad, breakfast potatoes or Raw and crunchy, the sourdough toast was outstanding, the waiter was great the place was nice, breakfast was the worst

A little disappointed. The 12 Rib eye  steak was just average, No spices and it was only warm like it had been setting on the plate for a while even thought service was quick. The baked potato was somewhat hard and dry like it had been in the warmer too long yet is was still only warm not hot. The French Onion soup was very good and the vegetables and bread was excellent. Waiters and service was outstanding.

We have always enjoyed eating here, but won't be returning. Came in for breakfast and both my husband and I ordered the steak and eggs. Ordered our steaks medium. When the plates arrived both of our steaks were charred and smelled charred as well. The steaks were hard to cut and the flavor of the steak was of burnt meat. Not pleasing at all. My steak looked more medium rare also.   They need to teach their cook how to cook steaks.

I have been here twice, and both times I have been impressed with the cleanliness, the service, and the food.  Monday nights they have $2.00 Margaritas, Bloody Mary's and something else, which is a great deal.  Had the filet medallions both times, and it melts in your mouth.  Their French Onion soup is awesome and the bacon wrapped shrimp was plentiful (7 large shrimp).  For the prices, you get quality food and a great atmosphere.

I see others noted the scent of smoke from the bar.  I didn't notice it either time I have been here.

Bon appetit!
Love the dining setup .  Server was nice and efficiant. breakfast was good steaks served flat iorned.  This is our new spot for breakfast  because its so quiet .

Went here with friends who like the breakfast, so I thought I'd give them another try.  We got there right before breakfast ended and were rushed to put in our order so she doesnt get in trouble?  Uh, ok...  So I just ordered the breakfast sandwich in a rush.  For $5.95 is was very small and the potatoes were old.  Tried some of my friends meals since I was done so quick and the french toast was pretty good, nothing special, and scrambled eggs were average tasting.  Service was fairly slow, forgot our silver wear and came after food was served, asked about one of the bloody marys and she didnt know anything about it because she was under 21.  Still not feeling this place, tried it again, but nothing tells me to come back, especially with so many other places close by.

I had the Steak here. It was cooked just the way I love it but there wasn't much flavor to it which I was pretty disappointed. It came with rice pilaf (that was ok) & vegetables. Decently priced but nothing special.

We are regulars as it just around the corner. 
We usually have the lamb chops which are excellent.
Last night I had the prime rib special which was fine. Unremarkable but ok. Bill had the ribs, a good safe bet.
The bread is really good and their sides are always fresh.

Only been in the bar area, which can get pretty smoky, however nachos are so good and easily a shareable size.  Steak is pretty good, burgers are too.  My husband had the lamb chop appetizer and it was very tasty.  Meat always cooked to order and of good quality!  Friendly bar staff, good service.

We had dinner here last night and really enjoyed it.  My bf has the ribeye and I had the fried zucchini (super delicious!) and a salad.  Everything was great.  4 stars for the drab decor but we will definitely be back!

We had originally tried this place shortly after they opened and it was very bad.. so bad that we avoided it for years.  Recently, however, a friend said he'd been there and it was very good, so we gave it another shot.. and we're glad we did.

I had the small filet and it was prepared perfectly.. not just in the right zone, PERFECT.  It was like eating meat candy.  My hubby got the rib-eye and he loved every bite of it also.

We returned a couple of weeks later and ordered the same meals.. and, once again, perfection.  

We're definitely becoming regulars here, so long as they keep this up.

Oh, fair warning though.. the mashed potatoes come with gravy on them unless you specify otherwise.. and they don't list that on the menu.  One waitress failed to mention that, which is how we found out.  Personally, I'm not a gravy fan.. hubby will eat anything with gravy on it but that's the southern boy in him.. I'm a yankee ;)

Love this spot!!! Amazing happy hour deals and great service. Been twice in the past two days and the bartender Mitch has taken great care of me! Bloody Mary's are out of this world! I'll have to come back and try the ribeye!

A solid four stars and each time I visit proves why Montana Meat Company (MMC), is becoming a "go to" experience regardless of the occasion.

The parking lot can get a bit busy, but this not an indication of what is happening inside.  A wall clearly splits the bar side from the restaurant side.  I have seen the restaurant busy, but nothing ever to the point that might negatively impact your dining experience.

The service is always friendly..sometimes not always punctual....but always friendly.

At this time I don't drift from these two awesome burgers..minus perhaps, the bun.

My first options is the "Peppercorn" burger. "[P]an seared with cracked pepper. topped with crispy fried potatoes and sauteed mushrooms. served with steak fries smothered in our creamy peppercorn gravy...just like in montana" (Retrieved from http://www.montanameatco.com/menu-3/).......$10.99.

My other option is the "New Mile High." [A] full one pound patty stuffed with bacon bits and american cheese. topped with lettuce, tomato, pickle planks, grilled mushrooms, melted swiss cheese, fried onion straws, and our secret "mile high" sauce. served on a toasted bun"(Retrieved from http://www.montanameatco.com/menu-3/).......$12.99.

I suggest the tator tots with your burgers.  Barrel shaped potato awesomeness over stringy......any day!

Bet when there is a crunch time dinner decision to be made.....MMC is at the front of the list.

Found this place while waiting to get my oil changed at the dealership. Ordered the Rocky Mountain Bacon Burger. It had bacon, BBQ sauce, pepper jack cheese, and an onion ring. It was juicy, delicious, and cooked to perfection. It also came with huge steak fries. My favorite.

Just read a disturbing post about this restaurant and couldn't help sharing about my experiences here. I was at the restaurant this evening and I noticed a table acting a bit unruly. I don't believe it's my job to tell someone how to manage their children but their actions were disruptive and made my visit uncomfortable. As for the restaurant, the Food is reasonably price and service is great. Whether I come in after work and watch a game with my buddies or bring the family for Sunday brunch, I always enjoy my time. Please don't let the last customers review sway you. Seeing the staff address the issue restored my faith in good service.

Food was good, service was slow, atmosphere was casual.
I ordered the burger that comes with gravy, the fries also have gravy on them. It was cooked perfectly medium. The gravy was seasoned well. My mom's steak sandwich was a little over cooked. She ordered the brown on the side, tasted like it came out of a can. The quality of the meat on both dishes was excellent. My husband ordered a Cobb salad. It was good, not great. I will definitely return for the steak. You can tell this is their focus, and they are doing it well.

Would not honor the 20.00 match play offered by Yelp. 
Food was good and priced appropriately got a bacon burger with fries. 10.95

This review is based on the fact that they would not honor the Yelp check in not food or service. 
Not a huge deal but don't offer it if you won't let customers redeem. Manager told bartender would only be honored on Wednesday however that's not what it says on Yelp and there is no sign.

Can we say...WINNING! My family and I had a wonderful "dinner experience" at the MMC. We started with the delicious Ahi appetizer and loved that.  For our entrée we ordered the two ribeye steak special.  My steak was cooked to perfection just as I ordered it. My daughter ordered the macadamia nut crusted halibut and enjoyed that.  We were served wonderful fresh baked bread with our delicious clam chowder soup. To top off this perfect experience our waitress "Lily" was on her "A" game. We finally found our family steakhouse.  Kudos to management!

This review is for just the restaurant,

I would have given higher, but you could smell smoke from the bar area,

The food was pretty good.

I had the sirloin , vegetables and baked potato. Everything tasted good. The service was also good.
Great Breakfast,  lunch & dinner. Always friendly fast service . Highly recommend. And carry out available.
We love this place for breakfast! Daytime crew is always attentive and the food is delicious!!!
This is what I missed most about Vegas. You can go to a bar at 2:30 am and get a great meal. Absolutely delicious lamb chops, boneless wings, onion rings, even their salsa was good.
I've been here about 4 times. Tonight service was subpar, but other times excellent. The same goes for the food tonight. Mondays :(

We went here a few weeks ago, and was not impressed. But friends raved about it, so we tried it again. 

We got there and it took forever to be taken to a table, even with the place 1/3 full. 

Then another huge wait to put in our orders. We both ordered the chicken with lemon. 

The food came out, with the bake potatoes half done. Finally got those switched out. 

Then trying to pay was impossible. Waited around a half hour. 

Then the next day - today - we were given a follow up. We both are suffering from diarrhea!  It happens we had missed lunch, so we are sure what caused it.  We should have written this place off after the first visit.

Probably not the best place for a steak. Bread wasn't finally delivered until the end of the meal because the waitress thought that since we had our food "You didn't need it." Chicken wasn't half bad but the service ruined it for me. Not going back.

My fiancé and I have been coming here for maybe about 3 years or so. We have always ordered the Rocky Mountain bacon burger. Never let's us down. Mark is basically the only reason we keep coming back(and for the food of course) his customer service is always 110%. He keeps us laughing the whole time!! Occasionally we have had some rude waitresses and it's shame the burgers aren't 2 for 1 anymore. Now they charge 50 cents for a side of ranch when before it was free. I think they changed the management which sucks but keep doing your thing Mark!! We will keep coming back for anyway :-D This place literally never  disappoints!

The food was outstanding as was the service.  The drinks and appetizers also were great.  The food also was not expensive.  The only down side was the attached bar smells of cigarette smoke and so when the connecting door opens the smell came in.

In short, the family and I have eaten at this establishment before and though the food was good, the service was nothing too spectacular... That is until our last visit. We had a new server, Carly, and though it seemed like we came it on an exceptionally busy day, her service was exemplary! She was friendly, courteous, professional, and above all she never forgot any of our many requests. All the while smiling and even conversating with the wife, making us feel right at home. Needless to say, we will be coming back frequently after this experience, thank you so much Carly, keep up the good work!
Great place in the Northwest,  awesome food, good service and great prices, wife and I went there valentine's day,  great steak, great service.

I was looking for a good yet affordable steak nearby for lunch. YELP suggested the  Montana Meat Company, and I am very pleased that it did!  I'll be returning here just to try more of the starters!  I absolutely loved the bacon wrapped shrimp, and there are three more starters I want to try ASAP. I paired that with a steak sandwich and salad, both of which were pretty much perfect. My only regret 
was that I didn't have sufficient capacity to try more menu items right away. (Of course, their ribeye would be perfect for dinner .....)

Went here for breakfast. Great service and servers are very friendly. But all three of us had cold meals. The server took most of the meals off. The one we sent back that was cold, came back out cold. They were not busy so this was unacceptable.

DO NOT GO HERE!!!
I had the absolute WORST restaurant/bar experience here. My friend and I went to this place, because he highly recommended it. We went there to watch our favorite football team, Team A, and thought it would be a good time. Well, my friend and I usually have the same taste in places, so I agreed. As soon as we walked in, the smell of dirty sewage hit my nose, and I asked my friend, "don't you smell that"? He said no, so we continued on to the bar. As we sat down in front of one of the TV's that our team on, we were greeted by the bartender, who is also the owner. He asked us what we were going to have to drink. I ordered a Dr. Pepper, my friend a Beer. He mentioned to us that there were a couple of team B fans in the place tonight, as he could see us wearing our team A jerseys. We said ok cool, no worries. We were there to watch the game and root for our team on, nothing more. As our team made some big plays, we clapped and cheered "yeah". We then asked the owner for some food menus. We placed our order and continued watching the game. In between plays, we noticed the other fans were at the end of the bar from us. We did not heckle them or even look there way. We were focused on watching the game and talking football amongst ourselves. Our team made another big play, and we clapped again, and yelled "yeah". I guess the owner had enough, as he then proceeded over to us and talk to me in a way I have never been talked to before. It went a little like this:
Owner: "Hey, can you not cheer until the other people leave, they are team B fans"
Me: "I can't cheer for my team"?
O: "Out of respect for me, please just don't cheer or clap, until they leave"
M: "Why"?
O: "Well I'm the owner, so I can turn the game off. Do you gamble"?
M: "No, I don't"
O: "Well that guy (team B fan) has $10,000 on this game, and he's already down $2,000"
M: "How is that my problem"?
O: "Please just don't cheer until they leave, that's all i'm asking"
M: "So I can't cheer for my team for the whole game basically"
O: "Yes"
M: I point to my soda, "How much is this"?
O: "I'll get it if you're going to leave"
M: As I get up from the stool "Yes I am""
My friend does the same and we walk out of that sewage plant. 

Once again, this has NEVER happened to me. EVER! I created a YELP account just so I can spread the word of this terrible business scaring off paying customers. It was number 1-a bar, number 2- we weren't scaring off customers or being obscene, number 3- there was a total of 7 people at a 20 person bar, number 4-isn't the customer always right?

Do not go here, do not give this man another dollar.
I always go here fore Philly cheesesteaks at night. It's always the same and that's how I like it.

I like this bar a lot, but I can see why others might not.  It's full of yocals and it's dark and smokey.   But, if you are okay with that (I am) try to sit at the bar.  Order one of the burgers and they are awesome.  I like the kobe sliders the best.

We usually have great service, but the last time we went? It was awful! First we were sat in 'family row' I hate that. I have well mannered children, please hear me when I say id like a quiet table. 

Where did we get sat?? Right by the entrance to the kitchen. Thanks hostess! Terrible. 

We waited for what seemed forever to have our order taken. And when the meals came out, mine was 8 minutes behind the rest of my family. Yes, I timed it. 8 minutes. I was a server. I know everyone's meals should arrive at the same time. Maybe the server took a break and said oh shit her food! I don't know. I was annoyed. 

Good food. I got the pot roast. Kids got a steak, ravioli, and chicken Parm. All wonderful. Husband got the 1/2 rack of ribs, and couldn't finish. I will say the sauce is sickly sweet. And thick. A little less would be nice. But they weren't mine, so there you go. Fresh veggies. Perfectly steamed. What they lacked in service this rime they made up with the food. Excellent.

In reply: 

Our server Friday night the 2nd was a black male. Quiet. He was polite, but the service was not what we are used to. We come here often and it was not good this time. The blonde hair gentleman who looks to be fresh off a surf board? Excellent service. Give him a raise.

nothing about this place is good.  not the food not the service nothing.  felt like I had been robbed.  go to the outback.
over priced
poorly cooked
staff couldn't care less.  there is a jack in the box up the street save yourself 60 bucks

HAPPY HOUR POWER! Whoever invented happy hour at any food establishment is a business tycoon because that's when the regulars come to your place and you get to know everyone's name. First time here and I'll say I wasn't very impressed (sorry to mislead you with that big intro!) and honestly, I expected more. I heard a lot from friends but now that I think of it, they were talking about the food.

It's what you would expect from a bar and grill: the dim lighting, the smell of cigarettes, and soft sound from the televisions in the bar. Upon entering, there wasn't a host/hostess to greet us so my girlfriend and I just stood looking at the Montana memorabilia in the doorway until Mark came to greet us. Just to be sure we came during happy hour and double checked with Mark and it seemed like Mark was new because he wasn't sure. The bartender had to grab the card on the bar table to tell us.

Mark sat us and took our order. I ordered the kobe sliders (what they're famous for) and my girlfriend ordered the peppercorn burger. We waited a little bit, not too long, for the order and there was an extra patty on the peppercorn burger. I thought it was kind of odd when Mark explained he had a new chef and he put an extra patty in the burger. He should've never added it :( My girlfriend seemed disappointed at how plain the peppercorn burger was and double checked with Mark if that's all it came with. Mark tried to appease her query of grilled onions by offering to get some.

Overall, it's what's expected from a bar & grill: mediocre service, mediocre food, and so a mediocre rating. Eh.

Being that we are from Montana, we naturally wanted to try this place. We came here a couple weeks ago on a Saturday night. It was around 6:30 and the employees were running around frantically as if there was a line of people waiting out the door; yet, there were open tables. (?) 
We were seated at a booth, ordered my daughter a drink, and waited. And waited. And waited longer. And waited some more. Until finally we left. They brought my daughter her drink but did not ask what we wanted to drink or come back to our table in over 15 minutes after that. I get that people need to be patient but this experience was just really odd and I had a bad feeling about how the meal would go if we stayed. We (politely) told them we had to go and haven't been back.  Maybe we will try it another time.

Been here 1-2 times before, service has always been slow but the food was fine so we decided to go there again today. It's Tuesday after 7:30 and the place was super empty! There was maybe 2 other tables. The hostess sat us down, brought us water, and then we waited. And waited. And waited. I saw 2 serves walk by us but they didn't stop to take our order. I asked the server if anyone was coming to take our order and she said she'd go get our server. And again, we waited. At this point we weren't willing to wait over 10 minutes at an empty restaurant so we left.
Great prices with big portions , gravy was cold on biscuits but still tasted awesome . Normal bar feel would be back again . And the bartender was very friendly! Will be back for sure
Best steak in town. Better than Ranch House. Consistent quality and excellent service.
Love this place. Open late night with full menu. Great service. Really good steaks. Never had anything I didnt like. Good breakfast specials.
Went once last year. Service sucked and the food sucked. Way overpriced. You're better off going to a bar and grill and getting the better of both.

When we first walked in, we were greeted by a nice gentleman. He had us wait a couple of minutes before he sat us. After sitting at the table the waiter can and introduced himself and got our drink orders. The drink orders took a bit longer than expected but they were pretty busy. I ordered the rib eye with baked potatoes and veggies and the lobster bisque soup. The soup was pretty good and the steak was pretty delish however I was a bit disappointed that is was so thin. They also messed up on my friends order when all she wanted was veggies and they gave her veggies and a baked potato. Over all the price is good, amptoshere is good, food is decent and service is pretty good. I would definitely eat here again!

We eat out often and I have never given a bad review ever but this was the worst place I have ever been to. It's also the first time I sent my entire meal back. The only thing that was decent was the service but after waiting forever for my meal and having to send it back it didn't make up for it.  Nor did a manager follow up after wards. :-(. #leavingarestauranthungry

Large healthy portions at a moderate price. The Kobe burger was over done from what we ordered. and did not taste like  Kobe. The jumbo shrimp were truly jumbo and tasted great. The onion rings were fantastic.
Fast friendly service. Clean establishment.

Pretty good service, even though they were fairly busy for a Sat morning. Service was attentive, but not overbearing. 

They ended up undercooking one of our steaks the first time, but the bartender (I didn't get her name, but she was good) was quick to remedy the situation, and actually ended up taking that order off our bill. 

Food was good, and a great price for the quality and portion size. 

Definitely will be back to try out their happy hour - I hear it's a great bargain, and if the filet medallions are on there, they're a must have.

The service was wonderful tonight but the steak was rubber cheap gross, and the side of veggies wasn't to be pluraled it was just green beans. My Bloody Mary w shrimp should have also included a description for the long string of feces it included. Overall really really sad and disappointing. Totally bummed we went.
The peppercorn burger is a must! It's messy but ohh so delicious!! The bacon wrapped shrimp and chicken Alfredo are also good. This will be my new go to spot
Ordered Calamari and Ribeye. Food was ok. Prices and service were good. Will go back but I think it will be more of a burger place than steaks
This is a hidden gem. My recommendation is to order the 12 oz rib eye and split a salad! So good!

The food was great,however the table they sat us at was horrible
Right by staff area and restrooms
Waitress never came around , the bus girl was good 
Only 2nd time there and will have to rethink if going back
It was like we were being punished 
They should never seated
 anyone at that table and waitress needs to come around and not approach after 15minutes waiting with want do you want 
Never asked if needed refills 
Too bad their staff blew it

Menus need to be updated for accuracy!
"RIGATONI BOLOGNESE 9.95served in a hearty beef and pork marinara sauce."  "Served with garlic bread".
I love bolognese.  Hearty meaty dish with marinara atop pasta.  Super simple.  I'm lactose intolerant (yes, seriously, and not because it's 'trendy'.).  I choose items from menus that I know, that don't contain (soft) cheeses, etc. 

What I received was not a marinara, it was more of a rose sauce (marinara loaded with cream until it's pink).  With melted mozzarella ALL OVER THE DISH.  The garlic bread?  Yeah, also loaded with cheese.  Google "bolognese" and you'll find a meaty red sauce; not creamy.  I would have expected a couple dashes of Parmesan (a hard cheese usually with less lactose), and I would not have minded this.  I didn't think I would have to explain to the waitress that I'm medically lactose intolerant and to hold all of the cheese when ordering a bolognese.  I've served tables before; servers don't want to hear your medical issues and life story.

For many people, all this cheese is wonderful news!  For me - a nightmare.  Nothing on the menu states that cheese or cream touches this dish all.  I did not bother to send this back because it was easier to just swap dishes with my hubby than piss off the staff and wait for a new meal.  At least update your menu to note that there is cheese and cream involved here.  Garlic bread should also be changed to CHEESY garlic bread.

For the record, the waitress looked puzzled when she checked back and saw we had immediately swapped plates, but never actually asked us about it.

It was about 9pm Thursday night. No hostess, and one server. I feel really bad for the server. He had about three or four tables and had a hard time getting our order in. We were in no rush and I am also a server so I understand that everyone else was cut to save payroll. Super nice guy, just the job was spreading him a little too thin. Management should have been helping him, I couldn't even identify if there was in fact a manager on duty. The food was mediocre and a little on the pricey side for casual dining. As this was my second mediocre experience there, I won't be going back.

Great food! Little things bugged me like the waiter wasn't very friendly. Didn't ask how I wanted my filet cooked or how I wanted my baked potato. The host was more of a waiter than ours was.

I give it four stars because again, the food was great. Just poor service.

I ordered the Ribeye it was thin and chewy. My husband also had the Ribeye, he said the same thing. We got stuck in an awkward table next to the kitchen door, the lighting and the staff going in and out was annoying. I watched one customer hunt down someone by going in the kitchen so he could pay his bill- I guess he didn't like how long he had to wait. I feel like a dinner for two that cost $68 dollars should not have a Denny's feel to it. Won't go back.

The ambiance is nice and the staff is really friendly, but the food.. awful. I ordered the filet mignon and it was so tough it tasted like a hamburger patty. I get my steak medium rare,  so there is no reason a filet should taste or look like that. The second star was just for the staff and how well they took care of us. Without them, I'd have given one star. We will never eat here again. You're better off at Outback.

Everything we had here was AMAZING. We started with lamb chops for an appetizer. So good! Then my husband had the country chicken Mac and cheese, my son had ribeye steak with mashed potatoes and gravy, and I had the Lil Puppy chicken wings. Everything, and I mean everything, was awesome. Our server was top notch and went above and beyond in service. We definitely will be back!

My girlfriend and I tried this place out a couple times. The atmosphere is really dark when you first walk in from a bright Vegas day. It takes some time to adjust and it's best to get a window seat but its not a killer. For the most part the place is clean and the staff is friendly. 

  As for the food, it really depends on what chef is there. The first time we went on a Sunday and we shared Bacon Wrapped Scallops which were unbelievable. I had the Rocky Mountain Burger which was the best burger I've ever had and my girlfriend got Kobe Beef sliders which she hasn't stopped talking about since. However the second time we went I was less impressed, this was on a Saturday. We shared Calamari and it was okay. I tried the jalapeño burger and it was good but I swear it tasted a little fishy. Whoever the chef was on Sunday is a master and should be there all the time. 

  The staff was very nice both times and often came up and asked how we were doing and got us more drinks without us having to ask. The prices are really great here, unless you don't get specialty drinks you could easily pick some things and end up with a total around 40 bucks and they don't overprice on most stuff and its a nice restaurant. I would definitely go there again and check it out if you're in the area.

We use to love coming to Montana Meat company. Today will be our last time.  We were ignored by the waitress while she had a personal conversation with a table that wasn't even hers. We waited 15 minutes to even be acknowledged by her. We asked the hostess a question and she referred us to the waitress that was ignoring us. We finally ordered, I got the prime rib which seemed t9 be cooked on a flat top. It was so tough. When I told the waitress she what I wanted her to do.

Hi all, 
My husband and I frequent this Steakhouse quite often.... 
My favorite is the the Grilled shrimp and Baked potato... the hubby loves the Lobster Tails....and the Ribeye....

The atmosphere is great, no screaming kids and the service is great... 

The price's aren't too high... but the food is definately worth every penny....

We ordered rib eye, it was the most chewy rib eye I've ever had in my life. They served bread that's still warm, looks fresh, it's all air inside. At least coffee was freshly made. I'm sorry I usually give good reviews and appreciate cuz it's food after all, but don't want people to get fooled, we payed $48 for coffee. Only thing we appreciated.

It was ok. Some of the steaks were overcooked, the server got a couple of plates switched (party of 7). The bread was unremarkable. The toppings on the baked potato were brought out in plastic to go containers 5 minutes after the food arrived. I ordered some kind of Long Island tea with mango or orange and it tasted like baby aspirin chewables. Not impressed .. No one in our party intends to come back.

Great for breakfast, they have lots of specials and really good pricing. I wouldn't give them 5 stars only because service could be a little bit better and faster. However everyone is friendly and food is never disappointing.

I ordered the 20 oz Montana Ribeye w/garlic mashed potatoes and veggies. The potatoes and veggies were good, but the steak wasn't that great. Though I enjoyed the size of the steak for the price, I wish the steak would've been more tender; a quarter of my steak was kinda dry which was a little disappointing. I almost busted out the A1 but kept my composure and just ate it. The wings here were good...I tried the "Seoul" flavor. The clam chowder was outstanding, along with the fresh bread. The cleanliness of the restaurant was good I suppose, though I never ventured pass my booth to assess the entire place. I liked how the glass doors separated the bar from the restaurant to prevent any cigarette smoke from leaking through. And finally, the service....that was the best part of this experience. Everyone was friendly and was constantly on the move. I don't think any of them stopped to take a break...just non-stop, excellent service. Thanks!
The bartenders are racist. I was told " The Alt-right lives here" " out if here beaner"

We eat here all the time. Been coming here for years and the service and food have always been awesome.
But today for breakfast the service was just terrible. We waited 12 minutes before someone took our order. I get they were busy but we've been here before when is was this busy and it was never this bad. The two stars is because of the service.  I can over look poor quality food, but when the service is poor, that just really bugs me.

Descent food at a reasonable price. Been here for all three, breakfast, lunch and dinner. Best meal has been dinner but they are not consistent. Sometimes meat is good and other times dry and tasteless. Sandwiches are ok. Get your food delivered quickly but if you need condiments or something ask quick as they drop and run.

Horrible service + horrible food = 0 Stars

Went yesterday July 4th with my mom and husband to have a nice lunch. They only had one server, the place was almost empty, now I know why.

Service:
- Waiter was very little attentive, we had to look for him constantly an order bread three times. A side note about the bread, it is not complimentary even though it is free for dinner. Why do you not offer it for lunch? It just makes your place look really cheap. I don't mind paying for it if is good, but we were 3 people and they brought 2 small slices, so not very satisfying. I also asked for it with butter and they never brought the butter.
- They had some bad taste rap music as background, which did not fit the environment whatsoever. I saw a couple older people there that I can guarantee you had the same thoughts I did. I wanted to ask the waiter to turn down the volume or change the music but again, I could not find the waiter, and then I just thought "whatever".

Food: 
My husband ordered a 20 OZ Rib Eye and I ordered a 20 OZ T Bone to share with my mom. 
Everything was hard and overcooked. I ordered medium well, got it well done.
And again: HARD, HARD, HARD.

It was overall a horrible experience, we wanted to have our meat fix for 4th of July and the experience was just depressing. Never coming back here. I hope management does something to improve.

I'm a huge fan of Montana's burgers. They are cooked to your liking and most importantly, seasoned well. Customer service is fair. The restaurant decor has a very laid back feel with a speciality in meat and seafood. The prices are affordable. I love the lunch specials from 11:00 am- 2:00 pm daily. So if your looking for flavorful quality food this place is a perfect lunch spot that won't break your bank.

Prime rib is the special and the reason we came.  Ordered our drinks and dinners.  Prime Rib was ordered rare and when it was served looked like a non-meat item.  Our waitress was happy to take back and eventually return to tell us that she was sorry, they only had well done available.  She told us that the manger said that he would take the prime rib off the bill, which was done.  However, I would expect better commutation between the cooks and wait staff and would have ordered a steak if was made aware of this before ordering and waiting for food.

Broken AC not so bad. 12 OZ. ribeye so tender you couldn't cut it with a chain saw and a pair of bolt cutters! Stringy to the point I was concerned how the Heinlich maneuver might feel on my fragile ribs. Definitely a 100 chew per bite zone. Stay away.  On the plus side, I was not charged for the steak.

Food was... Well, the steak was cooked perfectly. Vegetables that come with the entrees were over cooked by a country mile.  My husband and I had a beer and when mine was empty, I was never asked if I wanted another one however, my husband was asked... twice. WTH, I was thirsty. Service was all over the place; we got asked for our initial drink order by three different people and a server that just got off of her shift changed into a hooch outfit and was playing around in the kitchen doorway with other servers, then started screeching like a fool cat. It was like looking in a High School's cafeteria window at lunch break. The food was ok (meaning the steak) but I don't think it will be good enough for us to return. Service sure wouldn't be the reason... Consider another steak place if that's what you are looking for, there are so many above the bar in comparison to this place.  Get your act together Montana employees!
Nice little place with a great burger! I've been here a few times and it never disappoints. Good staff. Great if your local in Centennial Hills.

Between this store and their sister store on Durango, I eat there a couple of time a month, always the breakfast menu. 

It's unique in that all the breakfasts, with the exception of the steak and eggs, are one price, $4.95. Whether you order an omelet, biscuits and gravy, a scramble breakfast or my favorite "The Range" (chicken fried steak and eggs) it's $4.95.

I usually order the Range, which is very good, the other day I ordered "The Porker Scramble", ( Eggs, Potatoes, Green Peppers, Onions,Cheddar Cheese, Bacon, Ham and Sausage), it was also very good.

It's conveniently located. If you're shopping at Home Depot, Walmart, Sam's Club or shopping for a car.

If you want a good breakfast, at a good price, give them a try

Update:
Since I specifically stated prices in my review, I wanted to note the prices have increased. Now all the breakfast entrees are $5.95 and $6.95 (ex. the Range mentioned above is $5.95, the Porker scramble is $6.95). The steak and eggs and eggs benedict are $8.95. Still well worth the price and in a good location to get other tasks done.

I always get the lamb chops. They seem to be one of the few places where you can get good lamb chops. 
The wife had the ribeye which I tasted and I thought it was good as well. 
It was busy and they were "short handed", but the service was still very good. 
Over all a very good dinner.

I had a GC to here a couple years ago and it was a pretty horrible experience, but free so whatev.  I scratched it off my list and went about my life.  Then I got in a I-want-salad-but-am-wicked-lazy mood one week and exhausted all my local salad spots - which lead me back to Montana Meat.  
The salads sounded good so I went for the Walnut Chicken.  It wasn't the worst salad but the "mixed greens" was more iceberg than anything, cone to think of it, the entire salad was more iceberg than anything.  
It was decent sized, and with my own additional carrots, peppers, mixed greens, and tomatoes it was enough for dinner and a large lunch.
This place os AWESOME bread is light and airy made fresh in house. Everything we order was flavorful and delicious highly recommend will be back

This place was absolutely delicious I've never eaten black and salmon before the drinks was absolutely great we would definitely be back to this place!!! I heard the breakfast was phenomenal will be back to try it out thumbs up awesome awesome job and very inexpensive for what I had!!!!

What a nice find out in the centennial area! I'd been craving steak for a while and decided to go out and find one and with the help of yelp I wound up here! 

At first glance, it was a winner! There was a decent amount of cars in the parking lot and for it being close to 10pm that was a good sign! Well lit and just inviting enough to get me to come on in! 

We were greeted by the bartender and our server Mark followed shortly after! Let me say from the moment we sat down we probably stopped laughing just barely long enough to eat! Mark was so funny, informative, and a joy to speak to!

The menu was nicely organized, not waaay to many options to where I couldn't choose, but to the point! 
I wound up ordering 12oz ribeye with a baked potato and a side salad. Hubster ordered the blacked chicken alfredo! Both dishes were great! Although I didn't finish my steak, I'd suggest ordering the larger ribeye for a dinner portion because this one was quite thin...and surprisingly cooked at a perfect medium! The potato was a potato and the same for the side salad. 

A mentionable would definitely be the complimentary warm bread!! I almost jammed a fork in hubsters hand for reaching toward it too many times! Luckily Mark brought out more and spared his being! Hubsters Alfredo was actually divine. Possibly the reason I didn't finish my food was because I was eating his (Yes I'm a food hypocrite. No you can't eat our bread and yes you have to share with me!) 

In the end, we left smiling, fat,and full! Can't wait to come back and test out the lamb chops Mark suggested!

Seen my server once during our visit. My kids fries came out cold. Never got our bread. Horrible service scrappy food. Was never offered dessert. The busser helped us out more than our server who was very inattentive. The older couple next to us waited a good 15 minutes for their dessert. The restaurant wasn't busy so I think the server is just incompetent.
I have been going here for years, amazing service, great prices and wonderful food, including portions. Their breakfast is my favorite breakfast in town. Can't beat the price either!

Love this place!   DO NOT listen to those negative reviews, they are professional complainers!!!! (Don't believe me look at all their review about other companies). 

Eric showed such amazing hospitality.   I've never been treated so good at a establishment.   Awesome environment, good food, good drinks.   The staff was friendly.    Had the ribs and steak and I have to say damn good!   Would definitely recommend this place!

My sister and I ordered two range breakfasts and my mom ordered the breakfast sandwich...everything except the potatoes were good. Unfortunately the potatoes were almost cold, barely a hint of heat and the onions and peppers with it was raw.

We had a pretty good family dinner here Friday night. The service was bit off; our server was just a bit quirky for us but that's ok. He was definitely old school; gold rings and he had a crumb scraper which kind of gave my Mom the willies and my husband didn't like that he touched his glass (husband has restaurant experience). 
We had the spinach artichoke dip and potato skins for apps and they were awesome. I had the steak enchiladas. They were pretty good and the rice awesome, but for the love of god...there was a concrete slab of cheese on top. I figured there would be cheese and with a dairy allergy that was a risk I took, but I swear there were 16oz of cheese on top of three enchiladas. I scraped it off and when the server boxed my meal up, I asked him to leave the cheese. Be prepared; they have literally had a different menu every time I've eaten here. You can usually find something to good but don't count on eating an old favorite, because they'll probably axe it by your next visit.

I had been once before for breakfast and was impressed, so when my Yelp mentor PW suggested we go to Montana Meat Co. for dinner, I jumped at the chance. We took the better halves, so that in itself made it a good night. 

You won't find a lot of glitz and glamour, but the atmosphere is inviting and the service was good. They've got a good selection of brews and wines, along with a full bar.

The Mrs. and I arrived shortly before PW and MM, so the waiter brought some bread to the table to tide us over. It was warm and flaky and some kind of nice!  I tried to tackle the 20 oz. ribeye and added a salad. It already came with a huge baked potato and veggies. What was I thinking? I never leave with a "to go" bag, well used to never. It worked out well, as the steak was just a good the next night. It was cooked and seasoned to perfection.  

Definite return trips are in order for either a guys night out or a date night. As PW said on the way out, "A solid four stars".

Went in for breakfast cause someone else suggested it.  Got seated right away. All breakfast selections are from 5.95-8.95. Prices are fair and reasonable. I had biscuits n gravy that comes with potatoes. My wife had big sky breakfast 2 eggs with potatoes toast and side of bacon. Service was a little slow but not unreasonable. Got refills pretty quick w/o having to ask. My biscuits n gravy were good not great.  Gravy was a little bland and bicuits were very buttery tasting. Potatoes were the best part of everyones meal. Good flavor with chunks of onion and spices.

Long time patron of this establishment.   The service can be hit-or-miss at times, however there is great food and prices to be had here.  Their steaks are very good.  Maybe not the best in the city, but well worth the $15-20 price range for a rib-eye or top sirloin.  I was craving a decent steak house in Centennial Hills, and this place fit the bill.  We will return, again and again.

I've been to Montana Meat Company several times for the "Buy One Get One Free" (dine-in only) hamburger deal. With a decent selection of burgers (including kobe) at such a great price, they could taste like rhinoceros fart and they'd still be worth it! Luckily; they're all actually quite good (especially the kobe burgers).

If you are a cheapskate like myself and usually go to Montana for the hamburger deal, you probably aren't going to get an appetizer. But if you feel like living large, I highly recommend the lamb chops (I guarantee you'll want to lube yourself up with the honey basil sauce) and teriyaki chicken wings. 

The major issue that I have with Montana Meat Company isn't the food or the service. The problem with Montana is that the place flat-out needs cleaning. Last time I visited, there was a dead roach inside the building in the entryway. The time before that, there were tortilla chips on my seat. Unless you like sitting underneath lamps that are layered with dust for some reason, I really have nothing good to say about Montana (the state OR the restaurant) in terms of cleanliness.

If a dirty restaurant with the heavy smell of cigarette smoke doesn't bother you, visit Montana Meat Company today before BJ's put them out of business.

PS - I'm in a good mood. This place should automatically get one star for being a New York Jets bar.
Started off with bacon wrapped scallops, absolutely delicious, Cesar's salad....yum.  Then the 12 ounce ribeye,  with baked potato and mixed veggies.  Hint: keep that chef! What a great dinner!

I went to this place at about 10pm when we were just starved.  Tried the Kobe Sliders with Fried and Grilled Chicken with Onion Rings.  Everything was quite yummy and the portion sizes were generous. Prices were bar food typical (about $20-ish for 2 ppl).  I definitely would like to comeback and try their breakfast!  They did have an insert saying all items were now $4.99 so I'll have to update if/when I make it back.

As I walked into this restaurant, I didn't have high expectations. The parking lot was empty and the building was somewhat uninviting. Very little signage and the front door was very inconspicuous. 

My wife and I were greeted upon entering and seated right away. There were only a couple of other customers in the dining room and a couple in the bar. Our drink order was taken right away and the waiter was happy and very attentive.

My wife ordered the pot roast, which came with mashed potatoes and mixed vegetables and I ordered the fillet medallions, which came with mashed potatoes and grilled onions, smothered in a mushroom demi-glaze.

Our meals were fantastic! My medallions were cooked a perfect medium-rare, the mushroom sauce was rich and flavorful but not too overpowering. The mashed potatoes were, well, mashed potatoes. My wife raved about her pot roast and she is not a big red meat fan.

One of the best parts of the meal was the fresh cooked bread. After our drinks came and before our meal, our waiter brought us a wooden plank with a little slice of heaven. I remember when I was young and my mom made bread. I remember the smell of the bread as I walked in the house after a long day at school. As he set the bread down in front of us, the smell of fresh baked bread filled the air. I skipped the butter and tore into a piece and it was amazing. The texture, the taste, the aroma - this bread was fresh and hot. 

I must say I was pleasantly surprised with the Montana Meat Company. Not a great first impression, but , what a way to finish!

To my amazing fan Carlos L., the prices were pretty good. Our whole meal came to $38.00 before tip. Carlos is concerned about my spending habits - he thinks I'm cheap and should just stick to McDonalds. Have a great day Carlos.
First time with a bad experience and they were as bad as they possibly could be.  Nothing like normal.  Hopefully this is not the new norm.
Awesome place to go that's quite and low key on a Sunday afternoon.  Had the Diablo burger kobe style ( $2 extra) and it was delicious.

This is the second time coming to the Montana meat Co. The food doesn't taste fresh at all. My 10 OZ sirloin was undercooked and the vegetables were so saturated with oil it literally overflowed to the fries and made the fries so gross I had to drown in ketchup to eat. My daughters steak was over cooked and burnt. My wife's salad was gross with little dressing for the salad. The plate was almost 15 inches wide with a small 1" cup of dressing. A meat company should be known for cooking meat and making meat. I could have made the meat better if I went to the back and cooked it myself. $16.95 for a sirloin steak that was undercooked and I only ate the medium well areas.  I will not send food back when I cannot see the kitchen so yeah can't see the kitchen and don't trust people. 


I appreciate your response but I'm afraid that I don't see how the General Manager of a restaurant would not know what is going on in his kitchen. Regardless of the circumstances you are held responsible for the quality and service of the restaurant. You cannot pass the blame unto your staff and ask someone to come back and try us again. You should know what is going on in your kitchen and also know what needs to be done to rectify your situation in your KITCHEN. Your apology sounded more generic than actually sincere and also your lack of an answer about what occurred shows you don't really have a concern about customer service and a clue about how to fix it.

The place is always spotless and the food is always amazing but tge service is something completely sour. It can take up to five minutes to even be acknowledged at the door and dont get me started on wait staff! They can start off pleasant, out of the seven or eight times its always a toss up. This time our server never once came to our table, we had to wave her down at the 40 minute mark just to ask her about our order. I know earlier on I mentioned how the food is impecible but even that was ruined with our most recent visit. One of my party memebers food cane out ice cold! Once again our server was no where in sight so my friend had to get up and bring the cold food to her just to get it refired. That came promptly however we never even received an apology. I've always forgiven this place for all their faults because the food is so good but this is definitely the last straw. Will never be coming back to Montana Meat company ever again!

We went again this past Saturday night & we were REALLY craving the bleu cheese flat iron steak again. That is a special & they weren't serving it that night, but our server, Lili, asked the chef & he offered to make it for us! It was soooooooooo delicious!!!! Lili was great, too! All the food was cooked perfectly!!
Our thanks to Lili & the chef!!!!!

We went for lunch and I had the pot roast sandwich and my husband had a burger.  I really enjoyed the sandwich which comes with great steak fries.  The sandwich is open faced with pot roast and gravy all over on Montana toast.  Real comfort food!  My husband said his burger was a little dry and not very tasty but the toppings were great with bacon, lettuce, tomatoes and onions.  He also enjoyed his fries.

The atmosphere is a little dark so it's great for a romantic lunch or just a quiet getaway from the office.

To improve my sandwich plate, I think something fresh and green would add to it because right now it's all brown.
Thank you Mark for always making our dining a great experience! Quality service , with Quality food!

I went here on a Sunday evening. There were 4 of us in our party. We waited about 3 minutes at the front before one of the servers noticed us and said they would be right back. It was probably another 5 minutes before we could sit down and keep in mind there were only 4 or 5 other tables currently being used so it was pretty dead. When we received our food we were pretty disappointed. I ordered the filet medallions and so did my mom. I wanted mine medium and she wanted hers medium well. Mine was completely brown all the way through and hers had a slight pink in the middle so we switched. The mashed potatoes tasted like there was no seasoning and no milk or butter was used to make them. I mean who messes up mashed potatoes? I never got refills on my drinks and the server had to be hunted down to get a new steak knife that had fallen on the floor. The server came back with a fork and butter knife... I ended up just giving up my steak knife as the filet was not the best.

I love steak houses but I left there wishing we had gone to outback. That's just sad. This might have been a fluke and they might have great food but I'm not willing to give it another chance.

Great service, clean, smells very pretty considering it's a smoking atmosphere. The filet stack medallion appetizer (first dish I have tasted here ) is really good, flavors put together melt in your mouth with a crispy touch of blue cheese crumbs over toasted French slices of bread! Glazed with caramelized onions and balsamic reduction sauce. They say food overall is very good, well, they are damn right! First appetizer followed by three more, plenty to choose from and this, my friends, is not your regular gaming bar- kitchen.. For the price !! Forget about it! 
Oh! and they bring your meal hot, well presented and super fast! 

The actual owner is behind the bar and has been a pleasure to meet him. 

House wine selection was Pinot noir which is pretty good for my taste. Shots are "man's size"- 

Overall, friendly, small non so crowded place close to home. Good vibes! Very warming. Me like!

First time here and they have made a good impression so far. 

We ordered a cup lobster bisque and chili to start with. Both were excellent you could taste the lobster in it and the chili even though it had beans was very good.

We had the prime ribs sandwich special for lunch. It was on point! The onion rings are very good and fresh. The sandwich you could ask for anything more. I have had prime rib at 3x the cost that wasn't this good. 

The service is excellent not overly intrusive and not making it so you are looking for anything. 

The only complaint that I have is the wifi wasn't working in the back part of the restaurant portion.

Tried this place for the first time last night. We were greeted nicely and waited on by Harold. The whole staff was professional and friendly. My husband and I ordered steaks and our little guy ordered kids meal, chicken fingers. I asked for my steak to be well-done and butterflied. Unlike most nice Steak houses, there was no judgement or eye rolling and it came out perfectly! My husbands was also cooked to order. Do you also have Cajun spice available? We forgot to ask. We are so happy our daughter and her Bf told us about this place. We will be back for dinner and also to try your breakfast!

Iced tea tasted like soap. I ordered a steak salad which was ok but the tomatoes also tasted soapy. Yuck. Then I asked for the dressing on the side but the salad came out drenched in it. Service was very slow even though the place was pretty dead. Won't be coming back here again. The only saving grace was the rigatoni bolognese which my husband really liked.

I visited this place once to have a few drinks, it was a bit quiet that night, and I knew they served food so I looked at their menu. I was surprised to find entrees like Balsamic Glazed Halibut, Lamb Chops, 20 ounce Rib Eyes, and other such tasty things. I decided I would have to come back here again sometime with my girl and give it a go.

Since then my girl and I have been there twice and I went once with a friend to enjoy the menu and the drinks. I have enjoyed the shrimp cocktail, their lamb chops, rib eyes, flat iron steak, and their halibut.

* Classic Shrimp Cocktail: This was very enjoyable for both my girl and I, sweet and juicy jumbo shrimp and one of the best shrimp cocktails I have had in Las Vegas.
* Lamb Chops: While I am generally not a big fan of lamb, these are crazy good and after 11pm you can get 3 lamb chops for $7.95
* Rib Eyes: My girl and I both had the 12-ounce Rib Eye Steaks; this was up there with other good Steak Houses in Las Vegas. The meat was perfect medium rare for me and medium for my girl.
* Macadamia Crusted Alaskan Halibut with a balsamic glaze: I ordered this when my girl tried the flat iron steak, and while it was good, fresh and cooked right, I to be honest was jealous of my girls flat iron steak ;p
* Flat Iron Steak: So I was saying I was jealous of my girls flat iron steak and it was very nommy had a great sear and again cooked how she wanted it.

(I have noted that the grill person just rocks it all together as anything grilled here taste great so far.)

I would recommend if you are in this side of town to give this place a try as I have always enjoyed myself here.

Best Regards,
James "Culinary Schmooze" Williams

We waited for 5 minutes with no greeting and were the only people in line to be told they are no longer serving children! Maybe add a sign? We have gone there before with kids. They aren't that busy, doesn't seem like a good choice to turn away business.

When we feel like good burgers, we come here.
Service is usually good.  Today we come in, sit down & our table rocks.  Dark haired waitress comes over asking what we want, we tell her & I ask if she can fix the table.  She says "what do you want me to do about it?  Why don't you sit somewhere else". No, how about you get some napkins, matchbook or something to put under the table.  Seriously........where did customer service go? Blond bartender always kicks butt.

I have eaten here many times.
Food is fine, service typical of Vegas, now could you turn down the music?
There is no sense in the waitress not hearing me, and me not hearing her,
and me having to raise my voice to speak to somebody at my table.

Now I do NOT  notice this every time I am there, so I assume somebody turned this
blather nobody listens to up by accident.

I was starving and it was the middle of the night. Ironically, a vegetarian went to a meat company xD I did a pickup order and got huevos rancheros with seasoned potatoes and salsa. The potatoes were well seasoned and the cheesy delicious eggs were awesome. I didn't really like the refried beans on the huevos rancheros but it didn't take much away from the overall flavor. I'll definitely come back again! :)

Tonight was our first time here (late on a Tues night) We had the patty melt, big sky burger and I had a 12 oz ribeye (not bursting with flavor at all but, nicely marbled, a good cut and cooked perfectly). Would've been nice to see some more marinated steaks or sauces. All in all a good bang for your buck. Will probably try the sirloin next time. Not a huge fan of the chips that came with the spinach and artichoke dip but my kids ate it. The rest of our food was fast fresh and delicious! Even better was our server/host Mark!! So very friendly, made conversation with us and our kids and was so welcoming, professional and attentive. We will definitely be back!

Holy moly these are some great lamb chops I mean the lambs must be magical and come from where unicorns reside jeezzzzz!!!!!! Lol
Great food steaks lamb chicken etc!
Good service nice dim evening setting I highly recommend!!!!!

Four (4) years ago this was one of my family's favorite places to eat. We would eat there at least two to three times a week for breakfast and/or dinner.  Over the last four (4) years there has been a steady decline in the quality and quantity of the food. There have been times the service lacked if we didn't get our waiters but the food always seemed to make it worth it.  However, this weekend we went for breakfast, first time in probably three months, and it was the final straw and we WILL NOT be back now!  The order for French toast came with 4 halves of bread (2 slices) and ONE piece of bacon all for $9.00! When questioning the waiter we were told that is the new policy. You could tell he was embarrassed!  Where have you ever gone and you got one piece of meat?  If this sixths new policy then change the prices to reflect it. It's so sad to me because we really enjoyed going there and we will no longer. Looking forward to trying a new place that has a breakfast special for $5.95 for 2 eggs, 2 bacon or sausage, potatoes AND 2 pancakes!
Kids are welcome back. The steaks are still great. The bread is the best around. The service is still slow, but it's still a good meal.
Breakfast here was a bust, the potatoes were overcooked and the steak was teeny tiny. Dinner here is waaaaaay better.

Husband and my first time, what a nice surprise. Bread was oh-my-gosh good and everything came out hot and yummy. No kids in the restaurant so it was quiet and we were well taken care of by the staff. We'll be coming back.

I wouldn't come here again. Good for drinks. That's about it.  Aug 23, 2014 on sat at 10:05 I was served disgustingly over cooked bacon and everything is very bland and nothing special. I'm surprised this place has been open this long. I wish they would maybe just get a different  cook..

The steak was cooked just right, the macadamia nut encrusted halibut and chicken were superb. Nice quiet ambiance-especially for a Friday night. The service was very good. Our waiter was very attentive. Very knowledgeable on the menu items and wine selections. Great recommendations. We hadn't been here in a while, can't remember why. Will definitely come back more often.

We stopped in around 1pm on a Saturday.  It was not busy.  I had a sirloin steak and my wife had stuffed chicken breast with crab.  The chicken breast was over cooked and cold. She ordered mash potatoes and they were cold.  I ordered the 10 oz sirloin medium well and it came out rare to medium and was so tough I could not eat it. My baked potato was not cooked and it was hard.  I would have sent everything back but you never know what might happen. I will not come back. If it is not busy you would think good quality would be better.

Came in at 12 am. Sat in the bar area. Order the filet medallions medium rare. The steak was fantastic. Tender and pretty flawless. Mash potatoes complimented the steak nicely. The vegetables on the plate tasted fresh and well/lightly seasoned. Also, I ordered a water with lemon and it was exceptional quality.
The food is good but the service from the server is GREAT.  Mark is awesome and makes the dinner a great experience

I'm gonna preface this review by saying the food is very good here. I had the crab stuffed chicken breast and it was delicious. The service and wait time was ridiculous! We had to ask our waiter several times for water which was the first thing we ordered. The waiter wasn't very enthusiastic and seemed like he had better things to do than answer our questions. The food took over 30 minutes to come out. The waiter never once came over to check on us or let us know when our food would be coming out. A family sitting in a booth next to us got seated maybe 15 minutes after us and got their appetizers and food orders within 10-15 min of being there. When we finally got our food, my boyfriend's side order was wrong but we didn't bother trying to track down the waiter. We were too hungry at that point. We are very disappointed and probably will not come back.

I thought the steak needed more flavor.   It was too greasy, and not in the good way.  Fries okay.  Onion rings clearly not fresh.   It's a great idea with not so good on execution.  OK, not great.   It seems like there is potential, but needs help.

I don't dig the whole able to smoke at the bar type of deal.  Smoke smell wasn't strong in the dining areas but it was very much apparent.

Ordered the half rack of pork ribs with onion rings and veggies.  Meat was dry and flavor was decent.  I had to slather on more bbq sauce to make it somewhat enjoyable.  On the other hand, the onion rings were very very good especially when dipped in the ranch. Veggies were veggies.  Oh and the bread was also very good and warm.

Chris is right,I hate professional complainers too. I've been to Montana's many times,  since I work close to there establishment. I've had everything from there burgers, wings, sandwiches, appetizers, mixed drinks etc. and it's always fresh, juicy and delicious. Service is always on point and food arrives in timely manner. Don't listen to all the haters and go to Montana's and have a nice meal!

On the night we went to Montana, it was late and they were closing the dining room.  Or at least I think they were, so we elected to sit in the bar area.  While there, I was reading Yelp reviews, and must say that there was none of the overly smoky ambience that so many people had complained about.  It wasn't terribly crowded, either.  But a group of two couples at one end were soooooo loud that we had to move to a table on the other side to be able to hear each other and keep our eardrums intact.  Lucky for us, they left right before the food was brought.

What a deal!  Two burgers for the price of one isn't on the menu, but is always available.  Strange that you have to know about it, but at least we knew.  And we were there because it was late...and we knew.  There was also $2 off my glass of wine and hubby's beer.

The burger was very good, a little more well-done than the medium I'd asked for.  Hubby got the rarer one, which is a shame.  He's been well-trained to know enough not to order his meat cooked to DEAD when he's in my company (yeah, yeah, I know you're supposed to eat burgers well-done, but you pays yer money and takes yer chances).
